headline: New community batteries launch in Queensland and Victoria, Australia
summary_80w: Several new community batteries have been launched in Victoria and Queensland, Australia, to soak up distributed solar PV.

headline: AEMO: BESS secures the highest reliability amongst clean energy technologies in Australia
summary_80w: The Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) has found battery energy storage systems (BESS) are the most reliable clean energy technology in the National Electricity Market (NEM).

headline: China drives global BESS deployments in July, technology nears pumped hydro GW capacity
summary_80w: China continued to drive global grid-scale BESS commissioning activity in July, as the technology approaches the global installed gigawatt (GW) capacity of pumped hydro.

headline: R.Power to sell 440MW ready-to-build PV portfolio in Poland
summary_80w: Polish independent power producer (IPP) R.Power plans to sell a 440MW ready-to-build PV portfolio in its home country.

headline: Tariffs and AD/CVD ‘not welcome news’ say experts, as India treads the murky US markets
summary_80w: Indian PV manufacturers are facing double hit from US trade tariffs and anti-dumping measures on products sold in America.

headline: ACWA Power commissions 2.7GW Saudi PV portfolio
summary_80w: Saudi developer ACWA Power has started commercial operations of a 2.7GW solar PV portfolio in its home country.

headline: Dominance of PV and the shift to bifacial back contact c-Si technology in the next solar decade
summary_80w: Radovan Kopecek and Joris Libal examine the technological and economic factors driving PV’s ascendancy, with emphasis on bifacial BC modules.

headline: Foresight’s ARIF secures AU$700 million financing to diversify renewables portfolio
summary_80w: The Australian Renewables Income Fund (ARIF), a renewable energy fund managed by Foresight Group, has raised AU$700 million (US$779 million) in a debt refinancing transaction.

headline: Australia’s AEMO forecasts 229TWh of renewable energy generation by 2035 in the NEM
summary_80w: AEMO has predicted the NEM will see a steady rise in renewable energy generation capacity, reaching 229TWh by 2035.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Energy Vault, Richardson and Fluence make strategic supply chain moves
summary_80w: Three companies, Energy Vault, Richardson Electronics, and Fluence, have made strategic moves to create a secure BESS equipment supply chain.

headline: Iberdrola hires Ingeteam for 100MW/200MWh BESS hybridisation of PV plants in Spain
summary_80w: Spanish utility Iberdrola and power conversion specialist firm Ingeteam have partnered to hybridise Spanish operational PV plants with battery energy storage systems (BESS).

headline: State-owned utility commissions five new community batteries in Western Australia
summary_80w: State-owned utility Western Power has commissioned five new community batteries in Perth suburbs as part of a federally funded initiative in Western Australia.

headline: CTO interview with JA Solar
summary_80w: JA Solar's CTO, Zi Ouyang, discusses the company's latest module technologies and why the future is tandem.

headline: Canadian Solar’s Q2 module sales increase, battery revenues grow
summary_80w: Canadian Solar shipped 7.9GW of modules in the second quarter of this year, a 14% quarter-on-quarter increase.

headline: 33GW utility-scale solar installations forecast in 2025 – US EIA
summary_80w: The US Energy Information Administration (EIA) has forecast that the US will add 33.3GW of utility-scale solar PV in 2025.

headline: NTPC Green commissions 212.5MW of 1.2GW Khavda PV plant in Gujarat
summary_80w: National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC), through its renewable energy arm NTPC Green Energy, has commissioned 212.5MW of solar capacity at its 1.25GW Khavda-I project.

headline: Threshold projects scrapped, higher PPA prices, FEOC uncertainty: Life as a US BESS developer-operator post-OBBB
summary_80w: What does Trump's tax reconciliation bill mean for US solar and BESS project development and construction right now? We hear from developer-operator Agilitas Energy CEO Barrett Bilotta.

headline: North America energy storage acquisitions: FlexGen acquires Powin, Glencore acquires Li-Cycle
summary_80w: Two North American companies, Powin and Li-Cycle, were recently acquired by FlexGen and Glencore, respectively, after announcing bankruptcy.

headline: Ultra-low cost battery storage launch provokes price war discussion at Shanghai trade show
summary_80w: A product launch at this year's EESA Energy Storage Exhibition in China drew attention, discussion and even disbelief, reports Carrie Xiao.

headline: Statera brings online UK’s biggest battery storage project to date
summary_80w: Statera Energy has begun operating the biggest BESS project in the UK, connected to a National Grid substation that formerly supported two coal power plants.
